text:
We encountered problems using soft-links with suEXEC programmes of a casual
user: it appears links are not allowed.
However this is not stated in the manual
(http://httpd.apache.org/docs/suexec.html see 'suEXEC Security Model').  We
derived from rule 16. 'Is the target program NOT writable by anyone else?'

Also in the suexec.c code, the error message 'cannot stat program' is output for
both not being able to stat, but also if object is a link!  This should be
refined and also be put in the manual we feel.

Maybe the notion that a link is disallowed should be overruled and soft-links
should be allowed (if owner matches)?
creator: Frank.Schoeters@esat.kuleuven.be

text:
Apache HTTP Server 1.3.x is not supported anymore and no bugs will be fixed in the old codebase (cf. <http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/httpd-announce/201002.mbox/%3C20100203000334.GA19021@infiltrator.stdlib.net%3E>). Since this bug seems to affect only 1.3.x, I'm closing it as WONTFIX.

If this bug still affects you in a recent version (version 2.2.x or the upcoming version 2.4), please open a new bug.

Thank you for reporting the bug.
creator: mss@apache.org
